reviews.review_msg: Trevor will forever be my favorite professor. He is very clear with what he expects, and he is very reasonable with the content of the tests and the assignments, as he makes sure to relate everything to what is discussed in lecture. His office hours are very helpful, and he is super approachable! Take at least one course with him in your degree!
John's a nice enough guy, but he's not the best teacher. He posts videos in addition to his lectures, and you're better off just watching those at home and saving yourself the trip to campus.

First day of class stated "I mean if you use AI for your homework you could only get a B at best", so dont use it. 
Homework is worth 66% of the mark, and on the biweekly homeworks sometimes the students would get 0 feedback on their homework. Students complained in class and he simply said "I dont have time to give feedback for everyone"...

he deserves his rating. does not have clear criteria at all. gives you a grade without specific explanation. classes boring. does not even use canvas to remind things and assign grades. makes you frustrated about morphology. please definitely take 323 with another prof

He is a knowledgeable professor, even though sometimes it took time for me to understand the content, he was willing to help and reply emails fast. Read textbook really helped me. Teaching style did not suit me, but he is a good professor, just ask him question if you are confused. Quizzes are NOT easy.

John is a very difficult dude. Considering taking him for a course? Sit the semester out and wait for a different professor to teach it. Seriously. You won't get much support from this guy, and you'll learn much more from a textbook.

All over the place, Does not know what he is doing. Often unsure how to analyze the data, but expects us to know how to. Made us do Analytical summaries, but did not teach us prior knowledge.  Basically told us: Life is challenging, so I will give you more challenges. Not helpful during office hours . Leaves right after class. Textbook is better

Not bad at all. The course mainly focuses on 2 aspects, word schema and word syntax. His handwriting appears not good, however, the lec notes he provided were good enough. Textbook reading is recommended.

His basis for marking is unclear. You never know why you got a certain mark on an exam or homework. He doesn't like when you visit his office hours. Sometimes, you will get a 100 on the homework, and other times you will get a 70, but you will never know why.
He is very emotional. When he is happy, he is good. Overall I think he is not a good prof. The exams are not doable. Essays are very hard.

My favourite Linguistics professor at SFU.  He is very thorough AND encourages thinking further than what he's teaching.  His class was a lot of fun.  The final project was the most fun I've had with any project.
